tools.name: createBuildTask
tools.description: Create a new build task in CodeArts Build.  This defines how to build an artifact such as a Docker image or compiled code,  The created build task can be used in a pipeline through the official_devcloud_cloudBuild plugin.

endpointUuid.description: Optional object, can be empty or contain endpoint identifiers

iamEndPoint.description: Optional object, can be empty or contain IAM endpoint info

tools.name: queryCodeArtsBuildTasks
tools.description: Query CodeArts Build Tasks in a project. Build tasks define how to build artifacts  such as Docker images or compiled code, and may include steps to push them to a registry.

page_index.description: Page number, indicating that the query starts from this page. The value of page_index is greater than or equal to 0.

page_size.description: Number of items displayed on each page. The value of page_size is less than or equal to 100.

tools.name: queryCodeArtsBuildTaskDetails
tools.description: Retrieve the details of a specific CodeArts Build Task.  This includes its configured steps, environment, and actions,  allowing you to understand exactly how the task is set up to build and push artifacts.

job_id.description: Build task ID. The task ID contains the 32 digits and letters at the end of the browser URL when the build task is edited.

get_all_params.description: Specify whether returned parameters are complete.

tools.name: listCCEClusters
tools.description: List all Huawei Cloud CCE clusters in a project,  a CCE cluster can be used as an intrastructure resource for a Release Environment in CodeArts.

tools.name: queryCheckTasks
tools.description: Query the list of code check tasks in the CodeArts Check module. A code check task defines static analysis rules or security scans to evaluate source code quality.  These tasks can be used as steps in a pipeline using the `official_devcloud_codeCheck` plugin.

limit.description: Number of items displayed on each page. A maximum of 100 items are supported.

tools.name: listDeployApplications
tools.description: Query the list of Deploy Applications in the CodeArts Deploy module. A Deploy Application defines a series of deployment actions, such as deploying to Kubernetes clusters or host machines. It can be used to deploy a service or site written in any programming language. These applications can be reused in CodeArts pipelines via the official plugin `official_devcloud_deploy`.

project_id.description: Project ID. 32 characters, letters and digits.

states.description: Application status list (abort, failed, not_started, pending, running, succeeded, timeout, not_executed).

tools.name: getDeployApplicationDetails
tools.description: Retrieve the details of a specific Deploy Application in the CodeArts Deploy module. This provides the full configuration of the application, including the sequence of deployment actions  it is set up to execute (e.g., deploy to Kubernetes or host).  Use this to inspect how a deploy application is structured before using it in a pipeline.

app_id.description: Application ID (32 characters, letters and digits)

tools.name: queryDeploymentConfigurationList
tools.description: Get all deployment configurations of a microservice in CodeArts. A deployment configuration defines how a microservice in CodeArts should be deployed, including the deployment strategy (e.g., GitOps or ReleasePolicy), source git repository containing k8s deployment manifests (Helm chart or Kustomize). It is used when deploying a microservice instance in CodeArts Release environment.

offset.description: pagination start, the default value is 0

limit.description: pagination end, the default value is 10

tools.name: createDeploymentConfiguration
tools.description: Create a new deployment configuration for a microservice in CodeArts. The configuration defines how the microservice should be deployed, including its deployment engine (e.g., GitOps), the source Git repository containing Kubernetes manifests (e.g., Helm or Kustomize), target namespace, and other deployment metadata. This configuration is later referenced when deploying the microservice instance to a specific CodeArts Release environment.

tools.name: deleteDeploymentConfiguration
tools.description: Delete a deployment configuration of a microservice in CodeArts.

tools.name: updateDeploymentConfiguration
tools.description: Update an existing deployment configuration in CodeArts. Modify Deployment Engine (e.g GitOps), source git repository, artifact type (Helm or Kustomize), target namespace, Helm parameters.

tools.name: queryMicroserviceInstanceListByEnvironment
tools.description: Retrieve the list of Microservice Instances deployed in a specific Release Environment in CodeArts. A Microservice Instance represents the deployment of a microservice in a particular release environment.  It references target release environment, the microservice being deployed, and the deployment configuration that defines how the deployment is performed. It may also include an override of values from the deployment configuration, to allow environment-specific customization.

tools.name: createMicroserviceInstanceInEnvironment
tools.description: Creates a Microservice Instance by deploying the microservice to a release environment in CodeArts using the selected deployment configuration, supports overriding configuration values as needed. this operation will triggers creation of all associated Kubernetes resources defined by the deployment configuration in the environment.

tools.name: updateMicroserviceInstanceInEnvironment
tools.description: Updates an existing Microservice Instance deployed in a release environment in CodeArts, modify the deployment configuration or override values as needed.

tools.name: deleteMicroserviceInstanceById
tools.description: Delete a microservice instance deployed in a release environment in CodeArts This operation removes the microservice instance from the release environment and triggers the deletion of all associated Kubernetes resources defined by the deployment configuration.

tools.name: queryReleaseEnvironmentCategoryList
tools.description: Get codearts release environment category list, containing types (DEVELOPMENT, TEST, PRODUCT, PRE_PRODUCTION)  and id of each category

tools.name: queryReleaseEnvironmentList
tools.description: Retrieve the list of CodeArts release environments. An environment is a deployment target for microservice, It is linked with infrastructure resource (CCE container engine cluster, K8S cluster, UCS host)

tools.name: createReleaseEnvironment
tools.description: Create new CodeArts release environment, the environment resource is infrastructure cluster, that can be of type CCE, K8S or UCS, you give the resource details for an environment in the context object that is provided in the CreateEnvironment parameters, and each resource requires different fields to be filled in the context object and in the body object:  for CCE resource type, that is huawei cloud Cloud Container Engine,  1. list cce clusters to get a cce cluster id 2. fill  the cluster_id field in the body.context object, 3. fill empty string ( "" ) in the body.endpoint_id and body.endpoint_name for k8s resource type, that is service endpoint of k8s cluster, 1.  list service endpoints, find service endpoint of type k8s and get its id,  2. fill the body.context.endpoint_id and body.context.endpoint_name fields in the body.context object 3. fill the body.endpoint_id and body.endpoint_name fields in the body object as well, otherwise the k8s service endpoint wont be linked to the environment properly after creation of the release environment you can deploy microservice instances to it

cluster_id.description: Cluster ID, in case resource type is CCE, use this info from list clusters and get a cce cluster id, or leave empty if resource type is K8S or UCS

endpoint_id.description: Endpoint ID, in case resource type is K8S, use this info from list endpoints and get a k8s endpoint id, or leave empty if resource type is CCE or UCS

endpoint_name.description: Endpoint name, in case resource type is K8S, use this info from list endpoints and get a k8s endpoint name, or leave empty if resource type is CCE or UCS

region_name.description: Region name, use if resource type is CCE

user_type.description: User type 0 - current user, 1 - other users

tools.name: updateReleaseEnvironmentById
tools.description: Update CodeArts release environment information, such as description and infrastructure resource

cluster_id.description: Cluster ID, in case resource type is CCE, use this info from list clusters and get a cce cluster id, or leave empty if resource type is K8S or UCS

endpoint_id.description: Endpoint ID, in case resource type is K8S, use this info from list endpoints and get a k8s endpoint id, or leave empty if resource type is CCE or UCS

endpoint_name.description: Endpoint name, in case resource type is K8S, use this info from list endpoints and get a k8s endpoint name, or leave empty if resource type is CCE or UCS

region_name.description: Region name, use if resource type is CCE

user_type.description: User type 0 - current user, 1 - other users

tools.name: deleteReleaseEnvironmentById
tools.description: Delete CodeArts release environment, this deletes all microservice instances deployed in this environment as well

tools.name: deleteGitopsRuntime
tools.description: Delete Gitops Runtime installed on release environment in CodeArts after deletion copy the deletion command from CodeArts platform UI and run it on your k8s cluster or cce cluster to uninstall the Gitops Runtime

tools.name: GetGitopsRuntimeByEnvironmentResourceId
tools.description: Get Gitops Runtime installed on specified resource ( resource is k8s cluster or cce cluster) in CodeArts use this when you want to check whether the GitOps Runtime is installed on a k8s cluster or cce cluster that is a resource of a release environment in CodeArts. The GitOps Runtime runs on your Kubernetes (or CCE) cluster and acts as the deployment engine for microservice instances. It continuously compares the desired state of each microservice instancedefined by its deployment configurationwith the actual state in the cluster, and automatically applies changes to keep them in sync.

tools.name: createGitopsRuntime
tools.description: Creating a Gitops Runtime on specified resource ( resource is k8s cluster or cce cluster), after creation, obtain installation command from CodeArts platform UI and install the Gitops Runtime on your k8s cluster or cce cluster after installation, you can deploy microservice instances on the release environment and the Gitops Runtime will automatically apply changes to the cluster

tools.name: UpdateMicroserviceRepo
tools.description: Update CodeArts microservice code repository

type.description: The type of the repository. It can be codehub or gitlab.

http_url.description: The HTTP URL of the repository.

git_url.description: WarehouseGIT address, An SSH Git repository address is a secure URL-like string used to connect and interact with a remote Git repository over the SSH protocol.

language.description: The programming language of the component, should be one of the following - java, python, go, nodejs, php, none, other.

endpoint_id.description: The endpoint ID of the component.

tools.name: ShowMicroserviceDetail
tools.description: Query CodeArts Microservice details, show git code repository of the microservice

tools.name: ListMicroservice
tools.description: Query CodeArts Microservices list, a microservice is linked to a code repository,  a microservice can have deployment configurations, and can be deployed in a CodeArts release environment

body.description: Request body for querying the microservice list

tools.name: CreateMicroservice
tools.description: Create CodeArts microservice, choose git code repository,  after you create the microservice,  you can add deployment configurations for it, and deployed the microservice in a CodeArts release environment with the deployment configuration

name.description: The name should consist only of letters, numbers and _ without spaces or special characters.

type.description: The type of the component. It can be microservice or application.

parent_id.description: The parent ID of the component.

type.description: The type of the repository. It can be codehub or gitlab.

http_url.description: The HTTP URL of the repository.

git_url.description: WarehouseGIT address, An SSH Git repository address is a secure URL-like string used to connect and interact with a remote Git repository over the SSH protocol.

language.description: The programming language of the component, should be one of the following - java, python, go, nodejs, php, none, other.

endpoint_id.description: The endpoint ID of the component.

body.description: Response body for creating the microservice

tools.name: DeleteMicroservice
tools.description: Delete CodeArts microservice

tools.name: GetPipelineRunDetail
tools.description: Get pipeline status and execution details

pipeline_run_id.description: Pipeline run ID. 32 characters, digits and letters.

tools.name: DeletePipeline
tools.description: Delete pipeline

tools.name: QueryPipelineDetail
tools.description: Query pipeline details

tools.name: UpdatePipelineInfo
tools.description: Update pipeline

is_publish.description: Whether it is a release pipeline

alias.description: Code repository alias, The value can contain only letters, digits, and underscores (_).

items.description: Describes the source of the pipeline, e.g., a code repository.

branches.description: Branches to include in the trigger

exclude_branches.description: Branches to exclude from the trigger

tags.description: Tags to include in the trigger (for tag_push events)

exclude_tags.description: Tags to exclude from the trigger (for tag_push events)

paths.description: File paths to include in the trigger

exclude_paths.description: File paths to exclude from the trigger

create.description: Whether to trigger on merge request creation (for merge_request events)

merge.description: Whether to trigger on merge (for merge_request events)

update.description: Whether to trigger on merge request update (for merge_request events)

code_update.description: Whether to trigger on code update (for merge_request events)

reopen.description: Whether to trigger on merge request reopen (for merge_request events)

git_type.description: Type of git repository (e.g., codehub, github, gitlab)

endpoint_id.description: Endpoint ID for the git repository

is_auto_comment.description: Whether to automatically comment on pull requests

manifest_version.description: Pipeline structure definition version, new version defaults to 3.0

body.description: Template create pipeline request body parameters

tools.name: CreatePipelineNew
tools.description: Creating a pipeline

is_publish.description: Whether it is a release pipeline

alias.description: Code repository alias, The value can contain only letters, digits, and underscores (_).

items.description: Describes the source of the pipeline, e.g., a code repository.

tools.name: ListPipelines
tools.description: List pipelines/Get project pipeline execution status

is_publish.description: Whether it is a change pipeline

tools.name: RunPipeline
tools.description: Run pipeline

tools.name: queryCodeArtsPipelinePluginsList
tools.description: Query the CodeArts Pipeline plugins marketplace to discover available tools  that can be used as steps within a pipeline. These plugins represent reusable tasks such as codecheck, build, test, or deploy, and can be inserted into pipeline definitions to automate CI/CD workflows.

input_repo_type.description: Source code repository type, CodeArts Repo, GitLab, or GitHub.

business_type.description: use "", or business_type to filter plugins by category and use case

regex_name.description: use "", or single keyword without spaces

tools.name: queryCodeArtsPipelinePluginUsageGuide
tools.description: Retrieve the input configuration schema and usage instructions for a specific  CodeArts Pipeline plugin. This should be called whenever a plugin (tool/action)  is added to a pipeline, to ensure correct parameter values, required fields,  and proper usage. Use this to validate or generate the plugin's input in a pipeline definition.

plugin_name.description: plugin unique identifier, must be data.plugins_list.plugin_name  retrieved by using tool queryPluginsList

plugin_attribution.description: Plugin attribute. The value can be custom or official.  must be retrieved by using tool queryPluginsList

version_attribution.description: Version attribute. The value can be draft or formal.

tools.name: listProjects
tools.description: List all projects in CodeArts and obtain creator info ( such as user_id, domain_id ) about each project

tools.name: createWorkItem
tools.description: Create a new work item in CodeArts Work module.

project_id.description: The unique identifier of the project.

tracker_id.description: Work item type. The options are as follows: 2: task; 3: defect /Bug,5Epic,6Feature,7Story. The value 5 can only be the parent work item type of 6. 6 can only be the parent work item type of 7. The value 7 can only be the parent of 2 or 3.

tools.name: listWorkItems
tools.description: List work items of a project by creation time in CodeArts Work module.

project_id.description: The unique identifier of the project.

tools.name: getWorkItem
tools.description: Get work item details in CodeArts Work module.

project_id.description: The unique identifier of the project.

issue_id.description: The unique identifier of the work item.

tools.name: ListRepositoryMergeRequests
tools.description: Get merge request list of a repository in CodeArts Repo.

state.description: MR status. Values: opened, closed, merged, locked, all. Default: all.

page.description: Page number. A positive integer. Default: 1.

per_page.description: Number of records displayed on each page. Range: 02147483647. Default: 20.

search.description: String contained in MR titles or descriptions. Max. 100 characters.

tools.name: GetMergeRequestDiscussions
tools.description: Get reviews for a merge request in CodeArts Repo.

author_id.description: Filtered review comments created by user. The value can be user ID or username.

page.description: Number of the page whose review comments will be returned.

per_page.description: Every page with review comments will be returned.

tools.name: GetMergeRequestPipeline
tools.description: Get Merge Request last executed pipeline in CodeArts Repo.

tools.name: listProjectRepositories
tools.description: List all CodeArts Repo repositories in a project, can add search query with the name of the repo

tools.name: listServiceEndpoints
tools.description: List all service endpoints for a projet in CodeArts. Service endpoints provide links to third-party services to extend your DevOps experience through CodeArts. For example, a service endpoint can link you to a Git repository on GitHub to obtain source code, to Jenkins to complete certain tasks, or to a Kubernetes cluster to deploy containerized applications.

project_uuid.description: same as project id, this is required

tools.name: listSwrOrganizations
tools.description: List Huawei Cloud SWR (Software Repository For Containers) organizations
